[{"wordEn":"finger","wordAn":"dalíriʔ","langSubgroup":"WMP","langName":"Tagalog","wordEnLong":"finger","setnote":"This is a puzzling comparison for several reasons.  First, Tagalog appears to be the only Philippine language to have this form.  Second, the final glottal stop corresponding to zero in Old Javanese and Balinese suggests that it is a loan, but neither of these languages is a likely source.  Third, although Malay loanwords are common in many Philippine languages, this word is not reported in Standard Malay (Wilkinson 1959).
